alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 08 at 6:49PM EDT until August 08 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN OXFORD AND NORTHEASTERN COOS COUNTIES... At 649 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles east of Pittsburg, or 15 miles northeast of Colebrook, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Colebrook, Pittsburg, Dixville, Clarksville, Upper Cupsuptic, Oxbow, Parkertown, Lynchtown, Parmachenee, Bowmantown, Lower Cupsuptic, Seven Ponds, Stetsontown, Lincoln Plantation, Stewartstown and Wentworth Location. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
